Transcription-Unit.comment: The transcription level of rraB is not affected by the growth phase, and it is transcribed throughout the exponential and stationary phases [Zhou09]. On the other hand, rraB is involved in the cell envelope stress response, and it is modulated either by GlcN-6-P or by metabolites derived from GlcN-6-P [Zhou09].

Publication.title: Transcriptional regulation of the Escherichia coli gene rraB, encoding a protein inhibitor of RNase E.
Publication.author: Zhou L
Zhao M
Wolf RZ
Graham DE
Georgiou G

Evidence-Code.comment: The length of the (transcribed) RNA is experimentally determined. The length of the mRNA is compared with that of the DNA sequence and by this means the number of genes transcribed are established.

Evidence-Code.common-name: Automated inference that a single-gene directon is a transcription unit
Evidence-Code.comment: Automated inference of transcription unit based on single-gene directon. Existence of a single-gene transcription unit for gene G is inferred computationally by the existence of upstream and downstream genes transcribed in the opposite direction of G.

Promoter.comment:
The rraBp1 promoter overlaps an ArgR-binding site that represses the gene argI located upstream and in the opposite direction to the rraB gene [Zhou09]. However, the presence of arginine, which is the effector molecule of ArgR, does not affect rraB expression [Zhou09]. On the other hand, Khordursky et al. [Khodursky00] reported that the expression of rraB is modulated by tryptophan starvation, but the rraBp2 promoter does not respond to tryptophan availability [Zhou09].

Another putative promoter was identified upstream of the rraBp1 promoter, but its activity was not observed in a primer extension analysis [Zhou09]. The sequence of the region containing the active (rraBp1) and inactive promoter is well conserved in the upstream region of rraB and is homologous to that in other bacteria, such as Shigella flexnerii, Salmonella enterica, and several strains of E. coli [Zhou09].

The rraBp2 promoter was not identified by [Zhou09].

Evidence-Code.comment: Automated inference. A computer inferred this assertion through one of many possible methods such as sequence similarity, recognized motifs or consensus sequence, etc. When a person made the inference from computational evidence, use EV-COMP-HINF.

Publication.title: Sigma70 promoters in Escherichia coli: specific transcription in dense regions of overlapping promoter-like signals.
Publication.author: Huerta AM
Collado-Vides J

Evidence-Code.comment: The transcription start site is identified by primer extension.
A person inferred, or reviewed a computer inference of, promoter position relative to the -10 and -35 boxes.
